blocks.name: mulcncff
blocks.content: The multiplication of two continuous complex functions is continuous. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm mulcncff(class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(co(c0, cof(cmul), c1), co(c2, ccncf, cc)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, co(c2, ccncf, cc)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, co(c2, ccncf, cc)))
} = {
  eqeltrd(co(c0, cof(cmul), c1), co(c2, ccncf, cc), cmpt(hs0, c2, co(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cmul, cfv(c1, cv(hs0)))), w0)
  offval2(hs0, c0, cmul, c1, c2, cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c1, cv(hs0)), universe, cc, cc, w0)
  3syl(w0, wcel(c2, universe), wcel(c0, co(c2, ccncf, cc)), wss(c2, cc))
  cncfrss(c0, c2, cc)
  ssex(c2, cc)
  cnex()
  ffvelrnda(cv(hs0), c2, c0, cc, w0)
  ffvelrnda(cv(hs0), c2, c1, cc, w0)
  mulcncf(hs0, c2, cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c1, cv(hs0)), w0)
  eqeltrrd(cmpt(hs0, c2, cfv(c0, cv(hs0))), co(c2, ccncf, cc), c0, w0)
  feqmptd(hs0, c0, c2, cc, w0)
  syl(w0, wf(c0, c2, cc), wcel(c0, co(c2, ccncf, cc)))
  cncff(c0, c2, cc)
  eqeltrrd(cmpt(hs0, c2, cfv(c1, cv(hs0))), co(c2, ccncf, cc), c1, w0)
  feqmptd(hs0, c1, c2, cc, w0)
  syl(w0, wf(c1, c2, cc), wcel(c1, co(c2, ccncf, cc)))
  cncff(c1, c2, cc)
  diff.hs0.c(cmul)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
}

  cncff(c0, c2, cc)
  eqeltrrd((hs0 âˆˆ c2 â†¦(c1 ` hs0)), (c2[-cn->]â„‚), c1, w0)
  feqmptd(hs0, c1, c2, cc, w0)
  syl(w0, (c1 : c2 â†’ â„‚), c1 âˆˆ(c2[-cn->]â„‚))

blocks.name: subcncf
blocks.content: The addition of two continuous complex functions is continuous. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm subcncf(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, co(c1, cmin, c2)), co(c0, ccncf, cc)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), co(c0, ccncf, cc)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, c2), co(c0, ccncf, cc)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  cncfmpt2f(s0, c0, c1, cmin, c2, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), w0)
  a1i(w0, wcel(cmin, co(co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), ctx, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld)), ccn, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld))))
  subcn(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld))
  eqid(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld))
  diff.cmin.s(s0)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, ctopn, ccnfld)
  diff.ctopn.s(s0)
  diff.ccnfld.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: cncfmptssg
blocks.content: A continuous complex function restricted to a subset is continuous, using maps-to notation. This theorem generalizes ~ cncfmptss because it allows to establish a subset for the codomain also. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm cncfmptssg(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), co(c0, ccncf, c2)))
  -| wceq(c3, cmpt(s0, c4, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, co(c4, ccncf, c5)))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c0, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c2, c5))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(c1, c2))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  mpbird(w0, wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), co(c0, ccncf, c2)), wf(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), c0, c2))
  fmpttd(s0, c0, c1, c2, w0)
  syl2anc(w0, wb(wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), co(c0, ccncf, c2)), wf(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), c0, c2)), wss(c2, cc), wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), co(c0, ccncf, c5)))
  sstrd(c2, cc, c5, w0)
  syl(w0, wss(c5, cc), wcel(c3, co(c4, ccncf, c5)))
  cncfrss2(c3, c4, c5)
  eqeltrrd(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), co(c0, ccncf, c5), cmpt(s0, c0, cfv(c3, cv(s0))), w0)
  mpteq2dva(s0, c0, cfv(c3, cv(s0)), c1, w0)
  syl2anc(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wceq(cfv(c3, cv(s0)), c1), wcel(cv(s0), c4), wcel(c1, c2))
  sselda(cv(s0), c0, c4, w0)
  fvmpt2(s0, c4, c1, c2, c3)
  cncfmptss(s0, c0, c3, c5, c4, w0)
  nfcxfr(s0, c3, cmpt(s0, c4, c1))
  nfmpt1(s0, c4, c1)
  cncffvrn(c2, cmpt(s0, c0, c1), c0, c5)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm cncfmptssg(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  âŠ¢ (w0 â†’(s0 âˆˆ c0 â†¦ c1)âˆˆ(c0[-cn->]c2))
  âŠ£ c3 =(s0 âˆˆ c4 â†¦ c1)
  âŠ£ (w0 â†’ c3 âˆˆ(c4[-cn->]c5))
  âŠ£ (w0 â†’ c0 âŠ† c4)
  âŠ£ (w0 â†’ c2 âŠ† c5)
  âŠ£ ((w0 âˆ§ s0 âˆˆ c0)â†’ c1 âˆˆ c2)
  âŠ£ d(s0, c0)
  âŠ£ d(s0, c2)
  âŠ£ d(s0, c4)
  âŠ£ d(s0, w0)
} = {
  mpbird(w0, (s0 âˆˆ c0 â†¦ c1)âˆˆ(c0[-cn->]c2), ((s0 âˆˆ c0 â†¦ c1): c0 â†’ c2))
  fmpttd(s0, c0, c1, c2, w0)
  syl2anc(w0, ((s0 âˆˆ c0 â†¦ c1)âˆˆ(c0[-cn->]c2)â†”((s0 âˆˆ c0 â†¦ c1): c0 â†’ c2)), c2 âŠ† â„‚, (s0 âˆˆ c0 â†¦ c1)âˆˆ(c0[-cn->]c5))
  sstrd(c2, cc, c5, w0)
  syl(w0, c5 âŠ† â„‚, c3 âˆˆ(c4[-cn->]c5))
  cncfrss2(c3, c4, c5)
  eqeltrrd((s0 âˆˆ c0 â†¦ c1), (c0[-cn->]c5), (s0 âˆˆ c0 â†¦(c3 ` s0)), w0)
  mpteq2dva(s0, c0, (c3 ` s0), c1, w0)
  syl2anc((w0 âˆ§ s0 âˆˆ c0), (c3 ` s0)= c1, s0 âˆˆ c4, c1 âˆˆ c2)
  sselda(s0, c0, c4, w0)
  fvmpt2(s0, c4, c1, c2, c3)
  cncfmptss(s0, c0, c3, c5, c4, w0)
  nfcxfr(s0, c3, (s0 âˆˆ c4 â†¦ c1))
  nfmpt1(s0, c4, c1)
  cncffvrn(c2, (s0 âˆˆ c0 â†¦ c1), c0, c5)
}

thm addcncf(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, co(c1, caddc, c2)), co(c0, ccncf, cc)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), co(c0, ccncf, cc)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, c2), co(c0, ccncf, cc)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  cncfmpt2f(s0, c0, c1, caddc, c2, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), w0)
  a1i(w0, wcel(caddc, co(co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), ctx, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld)), ccn, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld))))
  addcn(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld))
  eqid(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld))
  diff.caddc.s(s0)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, ctopn, ccnfld)
  diff.ctopn.s(s0)
  diff.ccnfld.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: cncfshift
blocks.content: A periodic continuous function stays continuous if the domain is shifted a period. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:

  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, co(c2, ccncf, cc)))
  -| wceq(c0, cmpt(s0, c1, cfv(c4, co(cv(s0), cmin, c3))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  mpbir2and(w0, wcel(c0, co(c1, ccncf, cc)), wf(c0, c1, cc), wral(s0, c1, wral(hs2, crp, wrex(hs1, crp, wral(hs0, c1, wi(wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cv(s0), cmin, cv(hs0))), clt, cv(hs1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), cmin, cfv(c0, cv(hs0)))), clt, cv(hs2))))))))
  fmptd(s0, c0, c1, cc, cfv(c4, co(cv(s0), cmin, c3)), w0)
  ralrimivva(s0, hs2, c1, crp, w0, wrex(hs1, crp, wral(hs0, c1, wi(wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cv(s0), cmin, cv(hs0))), clt, cv(hs1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), cmin, cfv(c0, cv(hs0)))), clt, cv(hs2))))))
  mpd(wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wcel(cv(hs2), crp))), wrex(hs1, crp, wral(hs0, c1, wi(wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cv(s0), cmin, cv(hs0))), clt, cv(hs1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), cmin, cfv(c0, cv(hs0)))), clt, cv(hs2))))), wrex(hs1, crp, wral(hs3, c2, wi(wbr(cfv(cabs, co(co(cv(s0), cmin, c3), cmin, cv(hs3))), clt, cv(hs1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c4, co(cv(s0), cmin, c3)), cmin, cfv(c4, cv(hs3)))), clt, cv(hs2))))))
  syl2anc(wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wcel(cv(hs2), crp))), wrex(hs1, crp, wral(hs3, c2, wi(wbr(cfv(cabs, co(co(cv(s0), cmin, c3), cmin, cv(hs3))), clt, cv(hs1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c4, co(cv(s0), cmin, c3)), cmin, cfv(c4, cv(hs3)))), clt, cv(hs2))))), wral(hs2, crp, wrex(hs1, crp, wral(hs3, c2, wi(wbr(cfv(cabs, co(co(cv(s0), cmin, c3), cmin, cv(hs3))), clt, cv(hs1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c4, co(cv(s0), cmin, c3)), cmin, cfv(c4, cv(hs3)))), clt, cv(hs2)))))), wcel(cv(hs2), crp))
  adantrr(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c1), wcel(cv(hs2), crp), wral(hs2, crp, wrex(hs1, crp, wral(hs3, c2, wi(wbr(cfv(cabs, co(co(cv(s0), cmin, c3), cmin, cv(hs3))), clt, cv(hs1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c4, co(cv(s0), cmin, c3)), cmin, cfv(c4, cv(hs3)))), clt, cv(hs2)))))))
  rspcdva(hs4, co(cv(s0), cmin, c3), c2, wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c1)), wral(hs2, crp, wrex(hs1, crp, wral(hs3, c2, wi(wbr(cfv(cabs, co(co(cv(s0), cmin, c3), cmin, cv(hs3))), clt, cv(hs1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c4, co(cv(s0), cmin, c3)), cmin, cfv(c4, cv(hs3)))), clt, cv(hs2)))))), wral(hs2, crp, wrex(hs1, crp, wral(hs3, c2, wi(wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cv(hs4), cmin, cv(hs3))), clt, cv(hs1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c4, cv(hs4)), cmin, cfv(c4, cv(hs3)))), clt, cv(hs2)))))))
  ralbidv(hs2, crp, wceq(cv(hs4), co(cv(s0), cmin, c3)), wrex(hs1, crp, wral(hs3, c2, wi(wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cv(hs4), cmin, cv(hs3))), clt, cv(hs1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c4, cv(hs4)), cmin, cfv(c4, cv(hs3)))), clt, cv(hs2))))), wrex(hs1, crp, wral(hs3, c2, wi(wbr(cfv(cabs, co(co(cv(s0), cmin, c3), cmin, cv(hs3))), clt, cv(hs1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c4, co(cv(s0), cmin, c3)), cmin, cfv(c4, cv(hs3)))), clt, cv(hs2))))))
  rexralbidv(hs1, hs3, crp, c2, wceq(cv(hs4), co(cv(s0), cmin, c3)), wi(wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cv(hs4), cmin, cv(hs3))), clt, cv(hs1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c4, cv(hs4)), cmin, cfv(c4, cv(hs3)))), clt, cv(hs2))), wi(wbr(cfv(cabs, co(co(cv(s0), cmin, c3), cmin, cv(hs3))), clt, cv(hs1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c4, co(cv(s0), cmin, c3)), cmin, cfv(c4, cv(hs3)))), clt, cv(hs2))))
  imbrov2fvoveq(cv(hs4), co(cv(s0), cmin, c3), cabs, c4, cmin, cfv(c4, cv(hs3)), clt, cv(hs2), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cv(hs4), cmin, cv(hs3))), clt, cv(hs1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(co(cv(s0), cmin, c3), cmin, cv(hs3))), clt, cv(hs1)))
  breq1d(cfv(cabs, co(cv(hs4), cmin, cv(hs3))), clt, cv(hs1), cfv(cabs, co(co(cv(s0), cmin, c3), cmin, cv(hs3))), wceq(cv(hs4), co(cv(s0), cmin, c3)))

  mpbid(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c1)), wa(wf(c4, c2, cc), wral(hs4, c2, wral(hs2, crp, wrex(hs1, crp, wral(hs3, c2, wi(wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cv(hs4), cmin, cv(hs3))), clt, cv(hs1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c4, cv(hs4)), cmin, cfv(c4, cv(hs3)))), clt, cv(hs2)))))))), wcel(c4, co(c2, ccncf, cc)))
  adantr(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c1), wcel(c4, co(c2, ccncf, cc)))

  adantr(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c1), wss(c2, cc))
  elcncf(hs4, hs2, hs1, hs3, c2, cc, c4)

thm addccncf2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wss(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)), wcel(c2, co(c0, ccncf, cc)))

} = {

  constcncfg(s0, c0, c1, cc, wa(wss(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)))
  simpl(wss(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc))
  simpr(wss(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc))
  ssidd(cc, wa(wss(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)))

  mpan2(wss(c0, cc), wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, cv(s0)), co(c0, ccncf, cc)), wss(cc, cc))

  cncfmptid(s0, c0, cc)
  diff.wa.s(s0, wss(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc))
  diff.wss.s(s0, c0, cc)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c1, cc)
  diff.cc.s(s0)
}

blocks.content: The finite sum of continuous complex function is continuous. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm fsumcncf(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, csu(s1, c1, c2)), co(c0, ccncf, cc)))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c0, cc))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cfn))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s1), c1)), wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, c2), co(c0, ccncf, cc)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  eleqtrrd(cmpt(s0, c0, csu(s1, c1, c2)), co(c0, ccncf, cc), co(co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, c0), ccn, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld)), w0)
  fsumcnf(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, c0), cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), w0)
  syl2anc(w0, wcel(co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, c0), cfv(ctopon, c0)), wcel(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), cfv(ctopon, cc)), wss(c0, cc))
  a1i(w0, wcel(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), cfv(ctopon, cc)))
  cnfldtopon(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld))
  resttopon(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), cc, c0)
  eleqtrd(cmpt(s0, c0, c2), co(co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, c0), ccn, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld)), co(c0, ccncf, cc), wa(w0, wcel(cv(s1), c1)))
  adantr(w0, wcel(cv(s1), c1), wceq(co(c0, ccncf, cc), co(co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, c0), ccn, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld))))
  syl2anc(w0, wceq(co(c0, ccncf, cc), co(co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, c0), ccn, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld))), wss(c0, cc), wss(cc, cc))
  ssidd(cc, w0)
  cncfcn(c0, cc, co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, c0), cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), cfv(ctopn, ccnfld))
  eqid(co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, c0))
  eqcomi(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, cc))
  ax-mp(wceq(co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, cc), cfv(ctopn, ccnfld)), wcel(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), ctop))
  cnfldtop(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld))
  eqid(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld))
  restid(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), ctop, cc)
  unicntop()
  diff.co.s(s1, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, c0)

  diff.cfv.s(s1, ctopn, ccnfld)
  diff.ctopn.s(s1)
  diff.ccnfld.s(s1)
}

blocks.name: cncfperiod
blocks.content: A periodic continuous function stays continuous if the domain is shifted a period. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm cncfperiod(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(cres(c0, c1), co(c1, ccncf, cc)))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c2, cc))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cr))
  -| wceq(c1, crab(s0, cc, wrex(s1, c2, wceq(cv(s0), co(cv(s1), caddc, c3)))))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c0, cdm(c0), cc))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c1, cdm(c0)))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c2)), wceq(cfv(c0, co(cv(s0), caddc, c3)), cfv(c0, cv(s0))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(cres(c0, c2), co(c2, ccncf, cc)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  mpbir2and(w0, wcel(cres(c0, c1), co(c1, ccncf, cc)), wf(cres(c0, c1), c1, cc), wral(s0, c1, wral(hs2, crp, wrex(hs1, crp, wral(hs0, c1, wi(wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cv(s0), cmin, cv(hs0))), clt, cv(hs1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(cres(c0, c1), cv(s0)), cmin, cfv(cres(c0, c1), cv(hs0)))), clt, cv(hs2))))))))

blocks.name: subcncff
blocks.content: The subtraction of two continuous complex functions is continuous. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm subcncff(class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(co(c0, cof(cmin), c1), co(c2, ccncf, cc)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, co(c2, ccncf, cc)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, co(c2, ccncf, cc)))
} = {
  eqeltrd(co(c0, cof(cmin), c1), co(c2, ccncf, cc), cmpt(hs0, c2, co(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cmin, cfv(c1, cv(hs0)))), w0)
  offval2(hs0, c0, cmin, c1, c2, cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c1, cv(hs0)), universe, cc, cc, w0)
  3syl(w0, wcel(c2, universe), wcel(c0, co(c2, ccncf, cc)), wss(c2, cc))
  cncfrss(c0, c2, cc)
  ssex(c2, cc)
  cnex()
  ffvelrnda(cv(hs0), c2, c0, cc, w0)
  ffvelrnda(cv(hs0), c2, c1, cc, w0)
  subcncf(hs0, c2, cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c1, cv(hs0)), w0)
  eqeltrrd(cmpt(hs0, c2, cfv(c0, cv(hs0))), co(c2, ccncf, cc), c0, w0)
  feqmptd(hs0, c0, c2, cc, w0)
  syl(w0, wf(c0, c2, cc), wcel(c0, co(c2, ccncf, cc)))
  cncff(c0, c2, cc)
  eqeltrrd(cmpt(hs0, c2, cfv(c1, cv(hs0))), co(c2, ccncf, cc), c1, w0)
  feqmptd(hs0, c1, c2, cc, w0)
  syl(w0, wf(c1, c2, cc), wcel(c1, co(c2, ccncf, cc)))
  cncff(c1, c2, cc)
  diff.hs0.c(cmin)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
}

blocks.name: cnfdmsn
blocks.content: A function with a singleton domain is continuous. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)

thm cnfdmsn(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {

blocks.name: cncfcompt
blocks.content: Composition of continuous functions. A generalization of ~ cncfmpt1f to arbitrary domains. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm cncfcompt(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, cfv(c1, c2)), co(c0, ccncf, c3)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, c2), co(c0, ccncf, c4)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, co(c4, ccncf, c3)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  mpbird(w0, wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, cfv(c1, c2)), co(c0, ccncf, c3)), wf(cmpt(s0, c0, cfv(c1, c2)), c0, c3))
  fmpttd(s0, c0, cfv(c1, c2), c3, w0)
  ffvelrnd(c1, c2, c3, c4, wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)))
  adantr(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0), wf(c1, c4, c3))
  syl2anc(w0, wb(wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, cfv(c1, c2)), co(c0, ccncf, c3)), wf(cmpt(s0, c0, cfv(c1, c2)), c0, c3)), wss(c3, cc), wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, cfv(c1, c2)), co(c0, ccncf, cc)))
  eqeltrrd(cmpt(s0, c0, cfv(c1, c2)), co(c0, ccncf, cc), ccom(c1, cmpt(s0, c0, c2)), w0)
  fmptco(s0, hs0, c1, cmpt(s0, c0, c2), c0, cfv(c1, c2), c2, c4, cfv(c1, cv(hs0)), w0)
  fvmptelrn(s0, c0, c2, c4, w0)
  syl(w0, wf(cmpt(s0, c0, c2), c0, c4), wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, c2), co(c0, ccncf, c4)))
  cncff(cmpt(s0, c0, c2), c0, c4)
  eqidd(cmpt(s0, c0, c2), w0)
  feqmptd(hs0, c1, c4, c3, w0)
  syl(w0, wf(c1, c4, c3), wcel(c1, co(c4, ccncf, c3)))
  cncff(c1, c4, c3)
  fveq2(cv(hs0), c2, c1)
  cncfco(c1, cmpt(s0, c0, c2), c0, cc, c4, w0)
  sseldd(c1, co(c4, ccncf, cc), co(c4, ccncf, c3), w0)
  sylancl(w0, wss(co(c4, ccncf, c3), co(c4, ccncf, cc)), wss(c3, cc), wss(cc, cc))
  syl(w0, wss(c3, cc), wcel(c1, co(c4, ccncf, c3)))
  cncfrss2(c1, c4, c3)
  ssid(cc)
  cncfss(c3, cc, c4)
  cncffvrn(c3, cmpt(s0, c0, cfv(c1, c2)), c0, cc)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, c1, cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(c1, c2))
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c4)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
}

thm cncfcompt(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  âŠ¢ (w0 â†’(s0 âˆˆ c0 â†¦(c1 ` c2))âˆˆ(c0[-cn->]c3))
  âŠ£ (w0 â†’(s0 âˆˆ c0 â†¦ c2)âˆˆ(c0[-cn->]c4))

} = {
  mpbird(w0, (s0 âˆˆ c0 â†¦(c1 ` c2))âˆˆ(c0[-cn->]c3), ((s0 âˆˆ c0 â†¦(c1 ` c2)): c0 â†’ c3))
  fmpttd(s0, c0, (c1 ` c2), c3, w0)

  syl2anc(w0, ((s0 âˆˆ c0 â†¦(c1 ` c2))âˆˆ(c0[-cn->]c3)â†”((s0 âˆˆ c0 â†¦(c1 ` c2)): c0 â†’ c3)), c3 âŠ† â„‚, (s0 âˆˆ c0 â†¦(c1 ` c2))âˆˆ(c0[-cn->]â„‚))
  eqeltrrd((s0 âˆˆ c0 â†¦(c1 ` c2)), (c0[-cn->]â„‚), (c1 âˆ˜(s0 âˆˆ c0 â†¦ c2)), w0)
  fmptco(s0, hs0, c1, (s0 âˆˆ c0 â†¦ c2), c0, (c1 ` c2), c2, c4, (c1 ` hs0), w0)
  fvmptelrn(s0, c0, c2, c4, w0)
  syl(w0, ((s0 âˆˆ c0 â†¦ c2): c0 â†’ c4), (s0 âˆˆ c0 â†¦ c2)âˆˆ(c0[-cn->]c4))
  cncff((s0 âˆˆ c0 â†¦ c2), c0, c4)
  eqidd((s0 âˆˆ c0 â†¦ c2), w0)
  feqmptd(hs0, c1, c4, c3, w0)
  syl(w0, (c1 : c4 â†’ c3), c1 âˆˆ(c4[-cn->]c3))
  cncff(c1, c4, c3)
  fveq2(hs0, c2, c1)
  cncfco(c1, (s0 âˆˆ c0 â†¦ c2), c0, cc, c4, w0)
  sseldd(c1, (c4[-cn->]â„‚), (c4[-cn->]c3), w0)
  sylancl(w0, (c4[-cn->]c3)âŠ†(c4[-cn->]â„‚), c3 âŠ† â„‚, â„‚ âŠ† â„‚)
  syl(w0, c3 âŠ† â„‚, c1 âˆˆ(c4[-cn->]c3))
  cncfrss2(c1, c4, c3)
  ssid(cc)
  cncfss(c3, cc, c4)
  cncffvrn(c3, (s0 âˆˆ c0 â†¦(c1 ` c2)), c0, cc)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, c1, hs0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c((c1 ` c2))
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c4)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
}

blocks.name: addcncff
blocks.content: The sum of two continuous complex functions is continuous. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm addcncff(class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(co(c0, cof(caddc), c1), co(c2, ccncf, cc)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, co(c2, ccncf, cc)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, co(c2, ccncf, cc)))
} = {
  eqeltrd(co(c0, cof(caddc), c1), co(c2, ccncf, cc), cmpt(hs0, c2, co(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), caddc, cfv(c1, cv(hs0)))), w0)
  offval2(hs0, c0, caddc, c1, c2, cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c1, cv(hs0)), universe, cc, cc, w0)
  3syl(w0, wcel(c2, universe), wcel(c0, co(c2, ccncf, cc)), wss(c2, cc))
  cncfrss(c0, c2, cc)
  ssex(c2, cc)
  cnex()
  ffvelrnda(cv(hs0), c2, c0, cc, w0)
  ffvelrnda(cv(hs0), c2, c1, cc, w0)
  addcncf(hs0, c2, cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c1, cv(hs0)), w0)
  eqeltrrd(cmpt(hs0, c2, cfv(c0, cv(hs0))), co(c2, ccncf, cc), c0, w0)
  feqmptd(hs0, c0, c2, cc, w0)
  syl(w0, wf(c0, c2, cc), wcel(c0, co(c2, ccncf, cc)))
  cncff(c0, c2, cc)
  eqeltrrd(cmpt(hs0, c2, cfv(c1, cv(hs0))), co(c2, ccncf, cc), c1, w0)
  feqmptd(hs0, c1, c2, cc, w0)
  syl(w0, wf(c1, c2, cc), wcel(c1, co(c2, ccncf, cc)))
  cncff(c1, c2, cc)
  diff.hs0.c(caddc)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
}

blocks.name: cncfuni
blocks.content: A complex function on a subset of the complex numbers is continuous if its domain is the union of relatively open subsets over which the function is continuous. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)

blocks.name: icccncfext
blocks.content: A continuous function on a closed interval can be extended to a continuous function on the whole real line. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: cncficcgt0
blocks.content: A the absolute value of a continuous function on a closed interval, that is never 0, has a strictly positive lower bound. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:

  |- wi(w0, wrex(s0, crp, wral(s1, co(c0, cicc, c1), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cfv(cabs, c2)))))
  -| wceq(c3, cmpt(s1, co(c0, cicc, c1), c2))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cr))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cr))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(c0, cle, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, co(co(c0, cicc, c1), ccncf, cdif(cr, csn(nat0)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  r19.29a(hs0, co(c0, cicc, c1), w0, wrex(s0, crp, wral(s1, co(c0, cicc, c1), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cfv(cabs, c2)))), wral(hs1, co(c0, cicc, c1), wbr(cfv(ccom(cabs, c3), cv(hs0)), cle, cfv(ccom(cabs, c3), cv(hs1)))))

blocks.name: cncfdmsn
blocks.content: A complex function with a singleton domain is continuous. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm cncfdmsn(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)), wcel(cmpt(s0, csn(c0), c1), co(csn(c0), ccncf, csn(c1))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
} = {
  eleqtrd(cmpt(s0, csn(c0), c1), co(csn(c0), ccncf, csn(c1)), co(cpw(csn(c0)), ccn, cpw(csn(c1))), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)))
  cnfdmsn(s0, c0, cc, c1, cc)
  eqtr2d(co(cpw(csn(c0)), ccn, cpw(csn(c1))), co(csn(c0), ccncf, csn(c1)), co(co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, csn(c0)), ccn, co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, csn(c1))), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)))
  syl2an(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc), wceq(co(csn(c0), ccncf, csn(c1)), co(co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, csn(c0)), ccn, co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, csn(c1)))), wss(csn(c0), cc), wss(csn(c1), cc))
  snssi(c0, cc)
  snssi(c1, cc)
  cncfcn(csn(c0), csn(c1), co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, csn(c0)), co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, csn(c1)), cfv(ctopn, ccnfld))
  eqid(co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, csn(c0)))
  eqid(co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, csn(c1)))
  oveq12d(co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, csn(c0)), ccn, co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, csn(c1)), cpw(csn(c0)), cpw(csn(c1)), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)))
  sylancr(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)), wceq(co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, csn(c0)), cpw(csn(c0))), wcel(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), cfv(ctopon, cc)), wcel(c0, cc))
  simpl(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc))
  restsn2(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), cc, c0)
  sylancr(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)), wceq(co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, csn(c1)), cpw(csn(c1))), wcel(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), cfv(ctopon, cc)), wcel(c1, cc))

  eqid(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld))
  simpr(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc))
  restsn2(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), cc, c1)
}

blocks.name: divcncff
blocks.content: The quotient of two continuous complex functions is continuous. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm divcncff(class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(co(c0, cof(cdiv), c1), co(c2, ccncf, cc)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, co(c2, ccncf, cc)))

} = {
  eqeltrd(co(c0, cof(cdiv), c1), co(c2, ccncf, cc), cmpt(hs0, c2, co(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cdiv, cfv(c1, cv(hs0)))), w0)
  offval2(hs0, c0, cdiv, c1, c2, cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c1, cv(hs0)), universe, cc, cdif(cc, csn(nat0)), w0)
  3syl(w0, wcel(c2, universe), wcel(c0, co(c2, ccncf, cc)), wss(c2, cc))
  cncfrss(c0, c2, cc)
  ssex(c2, cc)
  cnex()
  ffvelrnda(cv(hs0), c2, c0, cc, w0)
  ffvelrnda(cv(hs0), c2, c1, cdif(cc, csn(nat0)), w0)
  divcncf(hs0, c2, cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c1, cv(hs0)), w0)
  eqeltrrd(cmpt(hs0, c2, cfv(c0, cv(hs0))), co(c2, ccncf, cc), c0, w0)
  feqmptd(hs0, c0, c2, cc, w0)
  syl(w0, wf(c0, c2, cc), wcel(c0, co(c2, ccncf, cc)))
  cncff(c0, c2, cc)
  eqeltrrd(cmpt(hs0, c2, cfv(c1, cv(hs0))), co(c2, ccncf, cdif(cc, csn(nat0))), c1, w0)
  feqmptd(hs0, c1, c2, cdif(cc, csn(nat0)), w0)
  syl(w0, wf(c1, c2, cdif(cc, csn(nat0))), wcel(c1, co(c2, ccncf, cdif(cc, csn(nat0)))))
  cncff(c1, c2, cdif(cc, csn(nat0)))

blocks.name: cncfshiftioo
blocks.content: A periodic continuous function stays continuous if the domain is an open interval that is shifted a period. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm cncfshiftioo(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {

  -| wi(w0, wcel(c5, cr))

  -| wi(w0, wcel(c6, co(c4, ccncf, cc)))
  -| wceq(c0, cmpt(s0, c1, cfv(c6, co(cv(s0), cmin, c5))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
  -| diffsc(s0, c6)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  3eltr4d(c0, co(c1, ccncf, cc), cmpt(s0, crab(hs0, cc, wrex(hs1, co(c2, cioo, c3), wceq(cv(hs0), co(cv(hs1), caddc, c5)))), cfv(c6, co(cv(s0), cmin, c5))), co(crab(hs0, cc, wrex(hs1, co(c2, cioo, c3), wceq(cv(hs0), co(cv(hs1), caddc, c5)))), ccncf, cc), w0)

  a1i(w0, wss(co(c2, cioo, c3), cc))
  ioosscn(c2, c3)
  recnd(c5, w0)

  syl6bb(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wrex(hs1, co(c2, cioo, c3), wceq(cv(hs0), co(cv(hs1), caddc, c5))), wrex(hs2, co(c2, cioo, c3), wceq(cv(s0), co(cv(hs2), caddc, c5))), wrex(hs1, co(c2, cioo, c3), wceq(cv(s0), co(cv(hs1), caddc, c5))))
  rexbidv(hs1, co(c2, cioo, c3), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wceq(cv(hs0), co(cv(hs1), caddc, c5)), wceq(cv(s0), co(cv(hs1), caddc, c5)))
  eqeq1(cv(hs0), cv(s0), co(cv(hs1), caddc, c5))
  cbvrexv(hs1, hs2, co(c2, cioo, c3), wceq(cv(s0), co(cv(hs1), caddc, c5)), wceq(cv(s0), co(cv(hs2), caddc, c5)))

  syl5eq(c0, cmpt(s0, crab(hs0, cc, wrex(hs1, co(c2, cioo, c3), wceq(cv(hs0), co(cv(hs1), caddc, c5)))), cfv(c6, co(cv(s0), cmin, c5))), cmpt(s0, c1, cfv(c6, co(cv(s0), cmin, c5))), w0)

blocks.name: cncfiooicclem1
blocks.content: A continuous function ` F ` on an open interval ` ( A (,) B ) ` can be extended to a continuous function ` G ` on the corresponding closed interval, if it has a finite right limit ` R ` in ` A ` and a finite left limit ` L ` in ` B ` . ` F ` can be complex-valued. This lemma assumes ` A < B ` , the invoking theorem drops this assumption. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: cncfiooicc
blocks.content: A continuous function ` F ` on an open interval ` ( A (,) B ) ` can be extended to a continuous function ` G ` on the corresponding closed interval, if it has a finite right limit ` R ` in ` A ` and a finite left limit ` L ` in ` B ` . ` F ` can be complex-valued. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)

blocks.name: cncfiooiccre
blocks.content: A continuous function ` F ` on an open interval ` ( A (,) B ) ` can be extended to a continuous function ` G ` on the corresponding closed interval, if it has a finite right limit ` R ` in ` A ` and a finite left limit ` L ` in ` B ` . ` F ` is assumed to be real-valued. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)

blocks.name: jumpncnp
blocks.content: Jump discontinuity or discontinuity of the first kind: if the left and the right limit don't match, the function is discontinuous at the point. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm jumpncnp(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wn(wcel(c0, cfv(co(c1, ccnp, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld)), c2))))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c4, cr))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c0, c4, cc))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cr))

  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cfv(cfv(clp, c1), cin(c4, co(c2, cioo, cpnf)))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c5, co(cres(c0, co(cmnf, cioo, c2)), climc, c2)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c6, co(cres(c0, co(c2, cioo, cpnf)), climc, c2)))

} = {
  mtbird(w0, wcel(c0, cfv(co(c1, ccnp, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld)), c2)), wa(wf(c0, cr, cc), wcel(cfv(c0, c2), co(c0, climc, c2))))

blocks.content: The finite product of continuous complex functions is continuous. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Apr-2020.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.content: Addition to a constant is a continuous function. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 8-Apr-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm add1cncf(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(c0, co(cc, ccncf, cc)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cc))
  -| wceq(c0, cmpt(s0, cc, co(cv(s0), caddc, c1)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  syl5eqel(c0, co(cc, ccncf, cc), cmpt(s0, cc, co(cv(s0), caddc, c1)), w0)
  addcncf(s0, cc, cv(s0), c1, w0)
  a1i(w0, wcel(cmpt(s0, cc, cv(s0)), co(cc, ccncf, cc)))
  mp2an(wcel(cmpt(s0, cc, cv(s0)), co(cc, ccncf, cc)), wss(cc, cc), wss(cc, cc))
  cncfmptid(s0, cc, cc)
  syl(w0, wcel(cmpt(s0, cc, c1), co(cc, ccncf, cc)), wcel(c1, cc))
  syl3anc(wcel(c1, cc), wcel(cmpt(s0, cc, c1), co(cc, ccncf, cc)), wcel(c1, cc), wss(cc, cc), wss(cc, cc))
  id(wcel(c1, cc))
  a1i(wcel(c1, cc), wss(cc, cc))
  ssid(cc)
  cncfmptc(s0, c1, cc, cc)
  diff.cc.s(s0)
}

thm fprodadd2cncf(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(c0, co(cc, ccncf, cc)))

  add2cncf(s1, cmpt(s1, cc, co(c2, caddc, cv(s1))), c2, wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c1)))

  eqcomd(co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), ccn, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld)), co(cc, ccncf, cc), w0)

blocks.name: fprodsubrecnncnvlem

blocks.name: fprodaddrecnncnv
blocks.content: The sequence ` S ` of finite products, where every factor is added an "always smaller" amount, converges to the finite product of the factors. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 8-Apr-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm fprodaddrecnncnv(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wbr(c0, cli, cprod(s0, c1, c2)))
  -| wnf(s0, w0)
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cfn))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c1)), wcel(c2, cc))
  -| wceq(c0, cmpt(s1, cn, cprod(s0, c1, co(c2, caddc, co(nat1, cdiv, cv(s1))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  fprodaddrecnncnvlem(s0, s1, hs0, c0, c1, c2, cmpt(hs0, cc, cprod(s0, c1, co(c2, caddc, cv(hs0)))), cmpt(hs1, cn, co(nat1, cdiv, cv(hs1))), w0)
  eqid(cmpt(hs0, cc, cprod(s0, c1, co(c2, caddc, cv(hs0)))))
  cbvmptv(hs1, s1, cn, co(nat1, cdiv, cv(hs1)), co(nat1, cdiv, cv(s1)))
  oveq2(cv(hs1), cv(s1), nat1, cdiv)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.cmpt.s(s1, hs0, cc, cprod(s0, c1, co(c2, caddc, cv(hs0))))
  diff.cc.s(s1)
  diff.cprod.s(s1, s0, c1, co(c2, caddc, cv(hs0)))
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.co.s(s1, c2, caddc, cv(hs0))
  diff.caddc.s(s1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.cmpt.s(s1, hs1, cn, co(nat1, cdiv, cv(hs1)))
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diff.hs1.c(cn)
  diff.hs1.c(co(nat1, cdiv, cv(s1)))
  diff.cn.s(s1)
  diff.co.s(s1, nat1, cdiv, cv(hs1))
  diff.nat1.s(s1)
  diff.cdiv.s(s1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs1)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs1)

}
